section.title: Mesh Data
section.paragraph: The mesh data is accessed in object mode and intended for compact storage, for more flexible mesh editing from python see bmesh.
Blender stores 4 main arrays to define mesh geometry.

list_item.paragraph: Mesh.loops (reference a single vertex and edge)

section.paragraph: Each polygon reference a slice in the loop array, this way, polygons do not store vertices or corner data such as UV’s directly, only a reference to loops that the polygon uses.
Mesh.loops, Mesh.uv_layers Mesh.vertex_colors are all aligned so the same polygon loop indices can be used to find the UV’s and vertex colors as with as the vertices.
To compare mesh API options see: NGons and Tessellation Faces
This example script prints the vertices and UV’s for each polygon, assumes the active object is a mesh with UVs.
section.literal_block:
import bpy
me = bpy.context.object.data uv_layer = me.uv_layers.active.data
for poly in me.polygons: print("Polygon index: %d, length: %d" % (poly.index, poly.loop_total))
# range is used here to show how the polygons reference loops, # for convenience 'poly.loop_indices' can be used instead. for loop_index in range(poly.loop_start, poly.loop_start + poly.loop_total): print(" Vertex: %d" % me.loops[loop_index].vertex_index) print(" UV: %r" % uv_layer[loop_index].uv)

desc_content.paragraph: Mesh data-block defining geometric surfaces
Animation data for this data-block
Maximum angle between face normals that will be considered as smooth (unused if custom split normals data are available)
Adjust active object’s texture space automatically when transforming object
Cycles mesh settings
Edges of the mesh
True if there are custom split normals data in this mesh
True when used in editmode
Loops of the mesh (polygon corners)
Polygons of the mesh
Display the mesh with double or single sided lighting (OpenGL only)
Display weights created for the Bevel modifier
Display creases created for Subdivision Surface modifier
Display UV unwrapping seams
Display sharp edges, used with the Edge Split modifier
Display selected edges using highlights in the 3D view and UV editor
Display selected edge angle, using global values when set in the transform panel
Display selected edge lengths, using global values when set in the transform panel
Display the angles in the selected edges, using global values when set in the transform panel
Display the area of selected faces, using global values when set in the transform panel
Display the index numbers of selected vertices, edges, and faces
Display face center
Display all faces as shades in the 3D view and UV editor
Display Freestyle edge marks, used with the Freestyle renderer
Display Freestyle face marks, used with the Freestyle renderer
Display statistical information about the mesh
All skin vertices
All UV maps for tessellated faces (read-only, for use by renderers)
All tessellated face colors (read-only, for use by renderers)
Tessellated faces of the mesh (derived from polygons)
Derive texture coordinates from another mesh
Texture space location

field_body.paragraph: float array of 3 items in [-inf, inf], default (0.0, 0.0, 0.0)

desc_content.paragraph: Texture space size

field_body.paragraph: float array of 3 items in [-inf, inf], default (0.0, 0.0, 0.0)

desc_content.paragraph: Use another mesh for texture indices (vertex indices must be aligned)
Selected edge count in editmode
Selected face count in editmode
Selected vertex count in editmode
Auto smooth (based on smooth/sharp faces/edges and angle between faces), or use custom split normals data if available
Adjust active object’s texture space automatically when transforming object
Use topology based mirroring (for when both sides of mesh have matching, unique topology)
X Axis mirror editing
Face selection masking for painting
Vertex selection masking for painting (weight paint only)
UV loop layer to be used as cloning source
Clone UV loop layer index
UV loop layer to mask the painted area
Mask UV loop layer index
All UV loop layers
All vertex colors
Vertex paint mask
Vertices of the mesh
(readonly)
Transform mesh vertices by a matrix (Warning: inverts normals if matrix is negative)

list_item.paragraph: matrix (float multi-dimensional array of 4 * 4 items in [-inf, inf]) – Matrix

desc_content.paragraph: Invert winding of all polygons (clears tessellation, does not handle custom normals)
Calculate vertex normals
Empty split vertex normals
Calculate split vertex normals, which preserve sharp edges
Free split vertex normals
Split faces based on the edge angle

field_body.paragraph: free_loop_normals (boolean, (optional)) – Free Loop Notmals, Free loop normals custom data layer

desc_content.paragraph: Compute tangents and bitangent signs, to be used together with the split normals to get a complete tangent space for normal mapping (split normals are also computed if not yet present)

field_body.paragraph: uvmap (string, (optional, never None)) – Name of the UV map to use for tangent space computation

desc_content.paragraph: Free tangents
Calculate face tessellation (supports editmode too)

field_body.paragraph: free_mpoly (boolean, (optional)) – Free MPoly, Free data used by polygons and loops. WARNING: This destructive operation removes regular faces, only used on temporary mesh data-blocks to reduce memory footprint of render engines and export scripts

desc_content.paragraph: Calculate smooth groups from sharp edges

field_body.paragraph: use_bitflags (boolean, (optional)) – Produce bitflags groups instead of simple numeric values
poly_groups, Smooth Groups, int array of 1 items in [-inf, inf]
groups, Total number of groups, int in [0, inf]

desc_content.paragraph: Define custom split normals of this mesh (use zero-vectors to keep auto ones)

field_body.paragraph: normals (float multi-dimensional array of 1 * 3 items in [-1, 1]) – Normals

desc_content.paragraph: Define custom split normals of this mesh, from vertices’ normals (use zero-vectors to keep auto ones)

field_body.paragraph: normals (float multi-dimensional array of 1 * 3 items in [-1, 1]) – Normals

desc_content.paragraph: update

list_item.paragraph: calc_edges (boolean, (optional)) – Calculate Edges, Force recalculation of edges
calc_tessface (boolean, (optional)) – Calculate Tessellation, Force recalculation of tessellation faces

desc_content.paragraph: update_gpu_tag
unit_test_compare

field_body.paragraph: Return value, String description of result of comparison

desc_content.paragraph: Validate geometry, return True when the mesh has had invalid geometry corrected/removed

list_item.paragraph: verbose (boolean, (optional)) – Verbose, Output information about the errors found
clean_customdata (boolean, (optional)) – Clean Custom Data, Remove temp/cached custom-data layers, like e.g. normals…

desc_content.paragraph: Validate material indices of polygons, return True when the mesh has had invalid indices corrected (to default 0)
Make a mesh from a list of vertices/edges/faces Until we have a nicer way to make geometry, use this.

list_item.paragraph: vertices (iterable object) – float triplets each representing (X, Y, Z) eg: [(0.0, 1.0, 0.5), …].
edges (iterable object) – int pairs, each pair contains two indices to the vertices argument. eg: [(1, 2), …]
faces (iterable object) – iterator of faces, each faces contains three or more indices to the vertices argument. eg: [(5, 6, 8, 9), (1, 2, 3), …]

warning.paragraph: Invalid mesh data (out of range indices, edges with matching indices, 2 sided faces… etc) are not prevented. If the data used for mesh creation isn’t known to be valid, run Mesh.validate after this function.

field_body.paragraph: The RNA type or default when not found.
The class or default when not found.
